jobDescription: THIS IS NOT A REMOTE OPPORTUNITY/ NO THIRD-PARTY VENDORSWho is Taos? Taos is an IT consulting and services company that offers expertise across the strategic, management and tactical layers of IT and engineering organizations. As part of the nation's IT landscape since 1989, we offer opportunities that will allow you to achieve your career goals and objectives.  We're changing the face of some of the most innovative companies with our diverse solution offerings, exceptional talent and thought leadership. Our clients look to us first for advice, insight, and support, driving us to relentlessly focus on customer success.  Taos is immediately hiring a Data Scientist for a cutting-edge tech company in San Francisco, CA! Who you are: You are an experienced Data Scientist with a passion for advanced data analysis. You appreciate a stable but fun start-up like environment. You are a hard worker and more importantly, a contributor to the continuously changing business and technological environments around you. You are detail-oriented, thrive on creating structure from chaos, and you have excellent written and verbal communication. You have the knowledge and experience necessary to act as the go-to person on your team for all things data analysis and data science. What youll be doing:Working with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutionsMining and analyzing data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategiesAssessing the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniquesDeveloping custom data models and algorithms to apply to data setsUsing predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomesDeveloping company A/B testing framework and test model qualityCoordinating with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomesDeveloping processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracyWhat youll bring with you:5 to 7 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical modelsMasters or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative fieldFamiliarity with the following:Coding with several languages (C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc.)Statistical and data mining techniques (GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.)Querying databases and using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data setsCloud technology from Oracle, AWS, AzureCreating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics (regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)Distributed data/computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark etc.)
